title: Dreamy Rose Day single-page dedication for Ashvena

requirements.summary: Replace the current Valentine proposal flow with a single-page dreamy Rose Day website dedicated to Ashvena with the exact hero heading text.
acceptanceCriteria: Visiting the app shows a Rose Day page (not the Valentine proposal buttons flow).
The primary hero heading text matches exactly: "üåπ Happy Rose Day, My Love Ashvena üåπ".
The page uses soft, romantic motion (subtle fades/float/pulse) and a pastel/glow aesthetic consistent across sections.

file_operations.description: Create the new single-page Rose Day experience with the exact hero heading text and a cohesive soft/romantic layout that will host the background, falling roses, interactive roses, special love message, and closing section.

Rename the current Valentine proposal page file to frontend/src/pages/RoseDay.tsx and refactor its content into the Rose Day single-page experience (removing the proposal yes/no flow and any navigation-away behavior).
Wire the app to render the new RoseDay page instead of the previous ValentineProposal experience so the Rose Day page is the default view.

requirements.summary: Add a realistic rose-garden background with soft pastel glow overlay and a smooth, continuous falling roses/petals animation layer across the whole page.
acceptanceCriteria: The page background is dominated by realistic roses in red/pink/white (not flat icons only).
A continuous falling animation of roses/petals is visible from the top of the viewport to the bottom.
Animations are smooth and non-jarring (no strobing), and do not block scrolling or interactions.

file_operations.description: Add the generated realistic rose garden background asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/rose-garden-background.dim_1920x1080.png and wire it as the primary page background.
Add the generated red rose cutout asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/rose-red-icon.dim_256x256.png for use in falling roses and interactive roses.
Add the generated pink rose cutout asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/rose-pink-icon.dim_256x256.png for use in falling roses and interactive roses.
Add the generated white rose cutout asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/rose-white-icon.dim_256x256.png for use in falling roses and interactive roses.

Create a full-viewport, pointer-events-none FallingRoses layer that continuously animates rose/petal elements from top to bottom using the realistic rose icon assets, ensuring smooth motion and no interaction blocking.
Apply the rose-garden background image with a soft pastel glow overlay and mount the FallingRoses layer across the entire page while preserving scroll and click interactions.
Add/adjust global dreamy rose-day keyframes/utilities (e.g., gentle fall, subtle float, soft glow overlay helpers) to support smooth, non-jarring falling animation and background glow.

requirements.summary: Add an Interactive Roses section with multiple clickable roses that reveal sweet messages; messages vary per rose and clicks cycle through available messages, including all required lines verbatim.
acceptanceCriteria: The Interactive Roses section renders multiple rose elements that are clearly clickable.
Clicking a rose reveals a message (e.g., tooltip/popover/card) without navigating away.
All listed messages appear in the app exactly as provided.
Different roses show different messages (not all roses always showing the same line).

Use shadcn-ui components (e.g., Card/Popover/Button if available) to present revealed messages with consistent styling; Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Add hover and focus-visible styling utilities for rose buttons (soft glow on hover, accessible focus ring) to make roses clearly interactive while keeping the dreamy aesthetic.

requirements.summary: Add a highlighted Special Love message area showing the dedication text exactly as provided.
acceptanceCriteria: A distinct, highlighted message box is present on the page.
The dedication text matches exactly and is easy to read over the background.

Happy Rose Day, my Jnu ‚ù§Ô∏è". requirements.summary: Add extra romantic decorative layers (floating hearts and sparkles), hover glow over roses, and a final closing section with the exact closing line text.
acceptanceCriteria: Floating hearts are visible (can reuse the existing floating hearts approach) and do not interfere with clicking roses.
Sparkles (animated or twinkling) are visible as a separate decorative layer.
Hovering a rose produces a soft glow effect.
A final section exists and the closing line text matches exactly.

file_operations.description: Add the generated sparkle/bokeh particle asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/sparkle-particle.dim_64x64.png for use in the sparkles layer.

Create a full-viewport, pointer-events-none SparklesLayer that places and animates/twinkles sparkle particles using frontend/public/assets/generated/sparkle-particle.dim_64x64.png with gentle, non-distracting motion.

requirements.summary: Use elegant cursive typography for headings/messages and update the document title to reference Rose Day/Ashvena.
acceptanceCriteria: Love messages and/or key headings use a cursive font family, with sensible fallbacks.
The browser tab title is no longer "Valentine's Day Proposal Website" and clearly references Rose Day and/or Ashvena.

file_operations.description: Update the document <title> to clearly reference Rose Day and Ashvena, replacing the existing "Valentine's Day Proposal Website" title. Also add any required font-loading tags (e.g., a cursive webfont) to support elegant cursive typography.
Add global font-family utilities (elegant cursive for headings/love messages with readable fallbacks) and apply them via reusable classes used by the Rose Day page/sections.
Apply the cursive typography styling to the hero heading and key love messages while preserving readability (sizes/contrast/line-height) over the rose-filled background.

requirements.summary: Add optional calm romantic background music with a user-controlled play/pause toggle that does not autoplay.
acceptanceCriteria: There is a visible play/pause (or music on/off) control.
Music does not autoplay; it starts only after user interaction.
Toggling reliably plays/pauses and does not spawn multiple audio streams.

file_operations.description: Create a reusable BackgroundMusicToggle component that manages a single audio instance (no autoplay; start only on explicit user interaction), provides a clear play/pause UI, and reliably toggles playback without spawning multiple streams. Optionally use shadcn-ui Button for consistent styling; Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Wire the BackgroundMusicToggle into the Rose Day page in a visible, non-intrusive position (e.g., fixed corner control) and ensure it does not overlap or block the interactive roses.
